headline.main: 3 Drug Makers Post Healthy Profit Gains

docs.abstract: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co, American Home Products Corp and Smithkline Beecham PLC report double-digit increases in earnings in first quarter; Warner-Lambert Co, however, says profits fell 18 percent; Bristol-Myers says earnings rose 12 percent; company earned $810 million, up from $726 million in year-earlier quarter; sales totaled $4.05 billion, compared with $3.67 billion; American Home Products earned $576.7 million, compared with $489.4 million a year earlier; revenue slipped 1 percent, to $3.6 billion from $3.65 billion; Smithkline Beecham earned $453 million, up from $398 million; sales were $3 billion, up from $2.9 billion; Warner-Lambert earned $204 million, compared with $249.5 million a year earlier; sales fell 2.7 percent, to $1.78 billion from $1.83 billion (L)
docs.lead_paragraph: Three big makers of pharmaceuticals and consumer products -- the Bristol-Myers Squibb Company, the American Home Products Corporation and SmithKline Beecham P.L.C. -- reported double-digit increases in earnings yesterday for the first quarter. But another, the Warner-Lambert Company, said its profits fell 18 percent. Bristol-Myers and American Home Products said slightly lower sales of medical products were offset by higher sales of drugs for ailments ranging from cancer to inflammation. SmithKline Beecham's earnings were driven by strong sales and a new antidepressant drug and nicotine-addiction remedies. But Warner-Lambert had weak sales in its consumer businesses and unfavorable foreign-exchange rates.
